N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.77 - Executive order no. 77: order relating to the establishment of the office of education performance review

State Regulations
I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, by virtue of the authority vested
in me by the Constitution and the laws of the State of New York, and as

Governor of the State of New York, do hereby establish in the Executive Chamber
an Office of Education Performance Review. The Office shall be headed by a Special Assistant for

Education Performance Review, who shall be appointed by the Governor and who
shall also be known as the Director of the Office. I. General Powers. The Office shall: (1)

Investigate and review the cost
effectiveness of public expenditures for the operation of the system of public
elementary and secondary school education in the State; and
(2)

Make recommendations for improving
efficiency, effectiveness and economy in the management, supervision and
implementation of public elementary and secondary school programs. II. Personnel. The Director may employ such additional personnel as he
deems necessary and desirable to fulfill the functions of the Office and
provide compensation within the amounts made available by appropriation
therefor. Signed: Nelson A. RockefellerDated: June 23, 1973
